title: Re: Transmeta's Crusoe as a host for neo-Lispm, or not?
content:
Subject: Re: Transmeta's Crusoe as a host for neo-Lispm, or not?
From: Erik Naggum <erik@naggum.no>
Date: 2000/01/20
Newsgroups: comp.lang.lisp
Message-ID: <3157383843342698@naggum.no>

* "Joe Marshall" <jmarshall@alum.mit.edu>
| Current processors are `C machines'.

  this belongs in comp.arch, I guess, but isn't this why Merced is a flop
  so far -- that is, since it _isn't_ a traditional "C processor"?

#:Erik
author: Erik Naggum
